<xvwx:matrix.dapp.org.uk> Regarding static analysis to detect issues due to reentrancy, I think the following papers may be interesting:

- https://arxiv.org/pdf/1801.04032.pdf
- https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-10769-6_1

They both discuss the notion of effective callback freedom (i.e. that executions with callbacks cannot result in new states that are not reachable by callback free executions).

author: bridge-bot
content:
<xvwx:matrix.dapp.org.uk> Certora is a great tool and very powerful. I think it's probably more capable than the currently available open source tooling. There is a nice overview of the currently available tooling and research here:

https://github.com/leonardoalt/ethereum_formal_verification_overview

I think the highlights would be:

- SolcMC: CHC based verification of solidity programs (built into the solc compiler): https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.17/smtchecker.html
- KEVM: A symbolic execution engine for the EVM built on top of the K framework. This can be used to symbolically execute foundry tests: https://jellopaper.org/foundry/
- hevm: A symbolic execution engine for the EVM implemented in haskell: https://fv.ethereum.org/2020/07/28/symbolic-hevm-release/

Over the longer term, we (the EF) are working on [act](https://github.com/ethereum/act), which would be more similar to certora (i.e. a specification language with automated invariant checking), but it's still a way off from being ready for serious production usage.
